qas.question: Besides Seurat where else are the beginnigs of Cubism found?

answers.text: in the two distinct tendencies of Cézanne's later work

qas.question: Cubists exploration of the concept of the simplification of forms into cones cylinders and spheres was further explored by whom?
Cubism revolutionized the way things could be seen in art how?

answers.text: all the surfaces of depicted objects in a single picture plane, as if the objects had all their faces visible at the same time.

plausible_answers.text: in the two distinct tendencies of Cézanne's later work

qas.question: Besides Seurat where else are the end of Cubism found?
Cubists exploration of the concept of the simplification of forms into cones cylinders and spheres was further not explored by whom?

plausible_answers.text: all the surfaces of depicted objects in a single picture plane

qas.question: Cubism revolutionized the way things could not be seen in art how?

context: In addition to Seurat, the roots of cubism are to be found <a0_0><b3_0>in the two distinct tendencies of <b4_0>Cézanne's<b4_0/> later work<b3_0/><a0_0/>: first his breaking of the painted surface into small multifaceted areas of paint, thereby emphasizing the plural viewpoint given by binocular vision, and second his interest in the simplification of natural forms into cylinders, spheres, and cones. However, the cubists explored this concept further than <a1_0>Cézanne<a1_0/>. They represented <a2_0><b5_0>all the surfaces of depicted objects in a single picture plane<b5_0/>, as if the objects had all their faces visible at the same time.<a2_0/> This new kind of depiction revolutionized the way objects could be visualized in painting and art.
